long: Meaning: to "be" (causative) "make well", literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right).  Usage: be accepted, amend, use aright, benefit, be (make) better, seem best, make cheerful, be comely,   be content, diligent(-ly), dress, earnestly, find favour, give, be glad, do (be, make) good(-ness), be (make) merry, please (  well), shew more (kindness), skilfully, Ã— very small, surely, make sweet, thoroughly, tire, trim, very, be (can, deal, entreat, go, have) well (said, seen).  Source: a primitive root;
